name: The Story of Samuel Quiz | Old Testament / Tanakh People | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Hannah and Elkanah.

	Hannah and Peninnah were the two wives of Elkanah. Peninnah could have children, but Hannah could not.

questions.text: The priest that Hannah spoke to was named Eli.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Eli thought she was drunk when he heard her praying at the temple. Hannah promised God she would give her son back to God if he would give her a son. Eli told Hannah that God would grant her request for a son. Hannah named her son Samuel which means "heard of God".

questions.text: Did Hannah keep her promise to give Samuel back to God?
questions.explanation:
yes.

	Hannah honored her promise she made to God and after Samuel was weaned she gave him to Eli. Samuel became the fifteenth judge of Israel.

questions.text: How many times did the Lord call Samuel while he was a child?
questions.explanation:
4.

	Samuel thought Eli was calling him and Eli told him the next time he heard the voice to respond, "Speak, for thy servant heareth". The Lord told Samuel that Eli's two sons would die.

questions.text: What were the names of Eli's two sons that the Lord told Samuel would be killed?
questions.explanation:
Hophni and Phinehas.

	Hophni and Phinehas were killed when the Philistines took the ark of the covenant. Shortly after his death, Phinehas' wife gave birth to a son she named Ichabod before she died.

questions.text: Eli had a heart attack and died after he heard of the death of his two sons.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Eli fell and broke his neck after hearing that Hophni and Phinehas were killed and the ark was stolen. He had judged Israel for forty years.

questions.text: How many sons did Samuel have?
questions.explanation:
Two & 2.

	Samuel had two sons, Abiah and Joel, who became judges in Beersheba.

questions.text: Which of these men did Samuel anoint as king of Israel?
questions.explanation:
Saul.

	Samuel anointed Saul king with a vial of oil and then kissed him.

questions.text: Did Samuel eventually turn his back on the first man he anointed king?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Samuel was ashamed that Saul had turned his back on God after he was anointed. Later, after turning his back on Saul, Samuel anointed David king of Israel and kept him safe from Saul's wrath.

Ramah.

	After Samuel's death, he was buried in Ramah where he grew up with Hannah and Elkanah before going to Eli.
